pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(boolean isWhite,
             int id)
        Constructs a new Piece given a color and id number of the type of piece
        Parameters:
        isWhite - whether or not the piece is white or black, true for white, false for black
        id - the ID number of the piece, 1-6, 1=pawn, 2=knight, 3=bishop, 4=rook, 5=queen, 6=king

    • Method Detail

      • getSprite

        public PieceSprite getSprite()
        Returns the PieceSprite object
        Returns:
        the PieceSprite

      • isWhite

        public boolean isWhite()
        Gives the boolean color value
        Returns:
        whether the piece is white of not. true = white, false = black

      • getPieceID

        public int getPieceID()
        Gives the ID of the piece assuming the id number of the piece and the color
        Returns:
        the ID of the piece. 1=white pawn, 2=white knight, 3=white bishop, 4=white rook, 5=white queen, 6=white king 7=black pawn, 8=black knight, 9=black bishop, 10=black rook, 11=black queen, 12=black king

      • getMoveSet

        public boolean[][] getMoveSet(Square[][] sqs)
        Gives the legal and illegal move-set of the piece
        Parameters:
        sqs - the 8x8 array or squares used in a chess game, containing a Piece object, either null or a type of piece
        Returns:
        the legal move-set

      • canCastle

        public boolean canCastle(Square[][] sqs,
                         boolean isMoveToRight)

      • isLegal

        public boolean isLegal(Square sq)
        Checks if moving to a reference to a square is a legal move the piece contained in the current square
        Parameters:
        sq - the reference to a square to check if moving to that square is legal
        Returns:
        true if the move is legal, false otherwise
